class TypedConstraint

Detailed Description

This is the actor class for Rigid Objects.

This class should be used to make any rigid object that can be moved as a result of force. Most objects will fall into this catagory. A few examples of a Rigid Object: Boxes, Car Frames, Chairs, etc. For Semi Rigid bodies that are deformable, like jello, it is better to use ActorSoft.

phys::ActorRigid::ActorRigid ( Real  mass,
String  name,
String  file,
String  group 
)

Descriptive constructor.

This constructor contains the basic information needed to make a Rigid Object.
This class inherits from ActorBase.

Parameters:
mass The mass the object will have in the World.
name The name of the actor.
file The 3d mesh file that contains the 3d model the actor will use.
group The resource group where the 3d mesh and other related files can be found.

Definition at line 67 of file actorrigid.cpp.

void phys::ActorRigid::CreateShapeFromMeshDynamic ( short unsigned int  Accuracy = 1,
bool  UseAllSubmeshes = false 
) [virtual]

Creates a collision shape from mesh file.

This function will read the location of every verticy in the mesh file and use that to construct a triangle mesh shape and attach it to this objects collision shape. This shoiuld be used with only with Dynamic objects.

Parameters:
Accuracy A value from 1 to 4. The higher the more accurate, but the more resource intensive

Todo:
  • Check for thread safety

Implements phys::ActorBase.

Definition at line 91 of file actorrigid.cpp.

void phys::ActorRigid::CreateShapeFromMeshStatic ( bool  UseAllSubmeshes = false  )  [virtual]

Creates a collision shape from mesh file.

This function will read the location of every verticy in the mesh file and use that to construct a triangle mesh shape and attach it to this objects collision shape. This shoiuld be used with only with Static objects.

Parameters:
UseAllSubmeshes If true, this will use the geometry of all submeshes of the model to make the shape. Otherwise it'll only use the first submesh.

Definition at line 240 of file actorrigid.cpp.

void phys::ActorRigid::LimitMovementOnAxis ( bool  x,
bool  y,
bool  z 
) [virtual]

Restricts movement on the axis or axies of your choice.

This function will lock any and all axies you define you want to be locked. Simply pass true to allow movement on that axis, false if you don't. This function is primarily useful for 2D games, in which if you are viewing the playing area from the side you can pass in LimitMovementOnAxis(true,true,false) and the object will only be able to move up, down, or side to side, but not in or out.

Parameters:
x Allow or Disallow use of the X axis for movement.
y Allow or Disallow use of the Y axis for movement.
z Allow or Disallow use of the Z axis for movement.

void phys::ActorRigid::RestoreActivation (  )  [virtual]

Restores the activation state of the physics body to normal.

This function is useful when you are done applying a constraint to a body, or any other effect that would have you call DisableDeactivation().

Definition at line 268 of file actorrigid.cpp.

void phys::ActorRigid::SetDamping ( Real  LinDamping,
Real  AngDamping 
) [virtual]

Sets the Damping for this object.

Both of Linear Damping and Angular Damping default to zero. This is usful if you wish to simulate something like air resistance. Values can range from 0.0 to 1.0.

Parameters:
LinDamping Real representing the amount of Linear Damping to be applied.
AngDamping Real representing the amount of Angular Damping to be applied.

Definition at line 252 of file actorrigid.cpp.

void phys::ActorRigid::SetIndividualGravity ( const Vector3 &  Gravity  )  [virtual]

Sets the gravity for only this object.

This value will override the world gravity. Should be called after adding to the world. When the object is added to the world the world gravity is applied to it.

Parameters:
Gravity Vector3 representing the direction and strength of gravity to be applied.
